comment._content: There are several other pictures of the Success in this collection. See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/tags/convictship/ www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3030263072/ has some links to information about her owner/captain.

comment._content: I'd live to know where this was taken, if anyone happens to know. Rich Norgard www.shipsuccess.com www.shipsuccess.blogspot.com Success on Facebook: www.facebook.com/pages/Sailing-Ship-Success/1 667473400368...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @rjnorgard One of the Bain photos on Success has a date of 4/28/13 written on it. That doesn't necessarily mean the picture was taken then, but might. An ad at top right of New-York tribune., April 30, 1913, Page 5 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1913-04-30/ed-... indicates that she was in New York City at the foot of 79th Street and Riverside Drive at the time. Since Bain was based in New York, this location seems a possibility. BTW, the following year, she was taking out full page ads in papers in Washington DC. The Washington times., June 05, 1914, HOME EDITION, Page 7 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1914-06-05/ed-...
